title: Love the new Shadow Isle stuff but you forgot someone
body:
I really love this new shadow Isle stuff but I am noticing a missing player to The Shadow Isle play

replies.body: Plot twist: Yorick underwent plastuc surgery, now lives in a temple and is known as Illaoi. Also, she's on the cover of Valoran Fair and was voted Woman of the Year for her brave step.

First rework to have a transgender.


......but {{champion:104}} still can't have a cigar.
Why must his quote "You will remember Yorick Mori" be so ironic.
So we can make the joke "Alas, poor Yorick"
I mean, people do remember him when they have to lane against him. It's the kind of thing you don't forget.

Long term (hopefully sometime next year, definitely not early next year) we've got plans for a major Yorick rework. We've got some preliminary thoughts on what that looks like internally, but haven't got enough sorted out to do a bio update for him at the moment.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GAt7KR74,comment-id=001c,timestamp=2015-10-28T17:55:28.947+0000)
>
> Long term (hopefully sometime next year, definitely not early next year) we've got plans for a major Yorick rework. We've got some preliminary thoughts on what that looks like internally, but haven't got enough sorted out to do a bio update for him at the moment.

_Alas, poor Rito..._

In all seriousness, I find this admission disheartening.  You guys have had years to get the base work done on Yorick, including a complete community project that was somehow rejected, and all you have after all that time is "some preliminary thoughts" and "sometime next year, we hope."

I keep joking with the handful of Rioters I haven't pissed off with my constant complaints about the Grave Digger that I might have to wait until after I turn forty (February 2017) to see a new skin for Yorick after five and a half years (by that time).  You just confirmed it with this admission, and that makes me sad.  So...

_I come to bury Rito, not to praise them..._  (Wrong play, I know, but whatevs, eh?)
None of us are happy with how little progress there has been on Yorick in the past 4 years, but we can still be grateful that we got a status update instead of radio silence or an overpromise.

They have been trying, it's not easy setting up a rework, especially when they are having a hard time figuring out the direction and identity Yorick should have. 

If you have an idea submit it, stop sitting on the sidelines bitching at them because they don't have ideas.

> [{quoted}](name=Silents429,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GAt7KR74,comment-id=001c00010002,timestamp=2015-10-29T00:14:17.437+0000)
>
> They have been trying, it's not easy setting up a rework, especially when they are having a hard time figuring out the direction and identity Yorick should have. 
> 
> If you have an idea submit it, stop sitting on the sidelines bitching at them because they don't have ideas.

I have given them plenty of ideas on Yorick.  They've all fallen on deaf ears, as it were.  Their focus has been on other things, for good or for ill, and they've almost permanently put the Grave Digger on the back burner.  Hell, there's no guarantee that Meddler's hopeful timeline might be plausible as Urgot might become a higher priority.
Maybe your idea just wasn't good? Don't suppose that crossed your mind.

In a way I am glad to hear this. But in the same breath I am very disappointed. Yorick has been ignored for so damn long, that he should be at the top of your list. I do not understand why the easy path is being taken by working on champs that are decent (they have some flaws but they are still playable) instead of looking at the ONE SINGLE champ that all of Riot says is toxic and was a terrible mistake(gameplay wise). Why continue to allow this one champion to be the only one taken out of free to play? Why ignore him for so damn long when you guys KNEW he was (and possibly still is) in the worst spot any champ has been in?
next year? so... next harrowing?
Well I'm glad; it's about time Yorick got his time in the rework spotlight!

> Hecarim recognized a crossroads in his life and made a decision that would damn him for eternity. Elise is already very fleshed out. She has her own purpose and has a pact with Vilemaw. We already know of her story and what role she plays in delivering souls to the Shadow Isles. 

Yorick and Eve are different stories. We know Yorick is only the sideman of the Isles. He's just there for ferrying and burying the bones of the dead. He carries on the family business and might have a motive not yet discovered. 

Eve as we know is an assassin. She could be for or against the Shadow Order and may very well have her own agenda to twist the order to do as she needs.
